Turnout was at a historic low of 26% (8). This election was the first since electoral structure reforms were implemented (10). There has been criticism of the conduct of the election and claims of state capture (1).

Timeline.Text: With less than two weeks until the Georgian parliamentary election on October 31st, New Eastern Europe provides an update on the latest developments.
Georgian citizens vote in the parliamentary election.
The ruling party, Georgian Dream, claims victory in the parliamentary election, securing a third consecutive term.
The House of Commons Library provides information on the 2020 presidential election in Tanzania.
Turnout for the parliamentary election is reported to be at a historic low of 26%.
Parliamentary elections are held in Romania, electing members to the Senate and Chamber of Deputies.
Transparency International reflects on the 2020 Georgian parliamentary election and the issue of state capture.
In May 2020, the Uzbek government announced electoral reforms ahead of the 2021 presidential election.

Overview.Summary: The 2020 Georgian parliamentary election took place on October 31, 2020 (3,5,6). The ruling party, Georgian Dream, secured a third consecutive term (1,2) with Giorgi Gakharia as their candidate for Prime Minister (4). A total of 66 political parties participated in the election (6) and the Central Election Commission stated that they must provide their party lists by October 1 (6). The election process was monitored by the National Democratic Institute (10) and the results were met with protests from the opposition (8).

Timeline.Text: Georgian citizens vote in parliamentary elections with a new electoral system in place.

Overview.Summary: The 2020 Georgian parliamentary election saw the ruling Georgian Dream party win, despite opposition protests (8,9). The party plans to establish a commission of inquiry into the election (1). The electoral commission reported that the party received 48.1% of the vote (8). The International Society for Fair Elections and Democracy (ISFED) adjusted its results of parallel vote tabulation (3,5). The Parliament confirmed Giorgi Gakharia as Prime Minister (6).

Timeline.Text: 11 political parties are projected to receive parliamentary seats in the upcoming 2020 Georgian parliamentary election.
The ruling Georgian Dream party wins the parliamentary vote, according to the electoral commission.
The opposition rejects the election results and stages a protest.
The Central Election Commission confirms the parliamentary election results, with the ruling Georgian Dream receiving 48.1% of the vote.
The ruling Georgian Dream party announces plans to establish a commission of inquiry into the 2020 parliamentary elections.
The newly-convened Georgian parliament confirms Giorgi Gakharia as Prime Minister and approves his cabinet.
The ruling Georgian Dream party presents their top 20 candidates for the 2020 parliamentary elections.
The International Society for Fair Elections and Democracy releases adjusted results of parallel vote tabulation, with the ruling Georgian Dream receiving 47.6% of the vote.
Kakha Kutchava of the ruling Georgian Dream addresses observers during the parliamentary elections.

Overview.Summary: The 2020 Georgian parliamentary election (1,2,3,4,5,6,8,9,10) occurred on October 31, 2020 (1). Charles Michel (2,7) reported on the results of the European Council and the Eurozone summit held on December 10-11, 2020 (2). The election results were certified on December 22, 2020 (4). The election was the first to be held under a predominantly proportional system (5), and 16 parties were registered to participate (6). The Central Election Commission summarized the results on December 3, 2020 (8), and the parliament of Georgia held its first session of the tenth convocation within ten days (8). The election had a historically low turnout of 33.2% (9). The governing party, Georgian Dream, claimed victory (10) and the opposition party, United National Movement, called for protests (10).

Georgia holds parliamentary elections, with the result expected to determine the country's future political path.
The ruling party in Georgia wins the parliamentary elections, but the opposition rejects the results and promises to protest.

Parliamentary elections are held in Romania, with the results to determine the composition of the Senate and Chamber of Deputies.
The second round of parliamentary elections is held in Georgia, under a new system based largely on proportional representation.
The final report on the Romanian parliamentary elections is released, examining the prevalence of toxic narratives in the political discourse.

The analysis of the 170 violations that we recorded and the 46 complaints that we filed makes it clear that the 31 October elections were a step back compared with the 2016 parliamentary elections.

Overview.Summary: The 2020 Georgian parliamentary election was held on October 31, 2020 (2,4,5,8,10,15,17). The ruling party, Georgian Dream, claimed victory with an overwhelming majority in parliament (16). However, the opposition party has called for protests and accused the ruling party of stealing the election (15,18,20). The election was the first since electoral structure reforms were implemented, switching from a majoritarian system to a predominantly proportional one (10). Before the election, there were attempts to influence the outcome through disinformation campaigns and cyber-attacks (6,18). The Central Election Commission has certified the results of the election (9,13).

Timeline.Text: Campaigning officially begins for the upcoming parliamentary elections in Georgia.
Voters in Georgia go to the polls to elect a new parliament.
The Georgian Dream party claims victory in the parliamentary elections, though opposition parties call for protests.
The ruling Georgian Dream party wins a third consecutive term in the parliamentary elections.
The Central Election Commission officially certifies the results of the parliamentary elections and sends them to the parliament.
Parliamentary elections are held in Romania, electing members to the Senate and Chamber of Deputies.
The ruling Georgian Dream party announces plans to establish a commission of inquiry on the parliamentary elections.
The 2020 parliamentary elections in Georgia are described as the worst since 2012.
The president of the European Council gives a report on the recent European Council meeting, including the parliamentary elections in Georgia.
The gazetted parliamentary election results are published for each constituency in Ghana.
An overview of the 2020 parliamentary elections in Georgia is published.
The president of the European Council gives a speech on the aim of achieving strategic autonomy for Europe.
